page.title: 05BEACON BOATHOUSE,SOUTH TOWN
page.content: The 17th century boathouse belonged to Manor House, which was pulled down in 1905 because South Town was too narrow for carriages.In the 19th century,the boathouse was used by coastguards,they watched the mouth of the river to check that ships were not smuggling in tobacco,French brandy etc..They kept their brigs in the boathouse and had workrooms in a house with a balcony nextdoor,now used as bedrooms.A leading light on the river wall steers boats safely into harbour.When the family moved here in 1963,they payed weekly rent of Â£4.50 to Dartmouth Charities,now it is Â£43.They filled in the boatslip and built an architect's office,but you can still see some of the old roofbeams.The first-floor room has big picture windows on the S and E side and wood panelling on the walls.
